noun.description: In the genitive, attributive, and with of, especially in "Brunner's glands". Designating the numerous small mucus-secreting glands located in the submucosa of the upper part of the small intestine.

origin: Mid 18th century. From the name of Johann Conrad Brunner, Swiss physician and anatomist, who described the glands bearing his name in Exercitatio anatomico-medica de glandulis in intestino duodeno hominis detectis.
